New Records: Virat Kohli scored an unbeaten 82 runs, leading India to a last-ball win over Pakistan in the T20 World Cup
Key Match Events: Virat Kohli and Hardik Pandya launched a fightback with a century stand, leaving India needing 16 off the final over
Mohammad Nawaz had a final over to forget, gifting India two wides and a no-ball that went for six
Ashwin coolly blasted over mid-off as India chased down 160 for victory
Pre-Game Insights: India have largely dominated Pakistan since the late 1990s but lost two of their three previous clashes
Few sporting rivalries match the passion of India-Pakistan
Post-Match Reflections: India captain Rohit Sharma praised Kohli's innings, saying 'Hats off to Virat. It has to go off as not one of his best, but the best innings he has played for India'
Kohli said 'I honestly have no words. I have no idea how that happened. Hardik(Pandya) kept telling me, just believe we can stay till the end. Iâ€™m lost for words'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played in front of 90,000 fans at the Melbourne Cricket Ground
The win was critical in a group that also includes Bangladesh, South Africa and qualifiers the Netherlands and Zimbabwe, with only the top two making the semi-finals
